titlestmt.subtitle: A description of the collection at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: MM

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Collection consists of eight documents of the Lowell Novelty Company from 1940 to 1941. The documents include a copy of the official drawings of Waterproof Accessory, and papers related to the Board of Directors and dissolution of the company.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Lowell Novelty Company was a small manufacturing company that operated in Lowell, Massachusetts. Ralph Zannoni was on the Board of Directors, Frank Benedetti was the President and Michele DeNicola was the treasurer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Lowell Novelty Company Records consists of eight documents of the Lowell Novelty Company from 1940 to 1941. The documents include a copy of the official drawings of Waterproof Accessory, and papers related to the Board of Directors and dissolution of the company.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has numerous holdings in the areas of plastics and industrial design. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

acqinfo.p: Transfer from National Plastics Center and Museum, 11/06/2008. Originally, gift of Rosemary Zannoni Folk, 2006.

scopecontent.p:
1. Copy of the Official Drawings of Waterproof Accessory. Prepared for F. Benedetti by Victor J. Evans and Co., Registered Patent Attorneys.
2. Resolution of the Board of Directors naming Frank Benedetti President and Michele DeNicola Treasurer with authority to sign checks, March 16, 1940.
3. Letter to Ralph Zannoni from Frank Benedetti with envelope, October 7, 1940
4. Notice stating Ralph Zannoni is authorized to lease premises for the corporation, March 16, 1940
5. Summons from the City of Lowell to attach goods at $300 and for the company to appear in court May 17, 1941
6. Notice of Board of Directors waiving notice of meeting, March 16, 1940 and April 29, 1941 (2)
7. Notice of Board of Directors authorizing Zannoni to sell property of corporation, April 29, 1941
